intro: Microchirita hamosa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chironji, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
